page.title: 01AXMINSTER
page.content: AXMINSTER. Aminster is a small market town in east Devon. The main function of the town is a service center for a largely rural community of pastrol farmers. The town is situated on the east bank of the river Axe approxmately 40 metres above sea level. This site is very old and is said to have been occupied by Iron age men,Romans and Saxons. Its advantages are that it is free from flooding and yet controls the best fording point above the sea of the Axe. The river Axe gets its name from the saxon "Axa"meaning fish. To day the river still plays an important part in the life of the community by providing fishing and good walks,it also floods each year..
